title: Damian Penaud has the stage to show he is the next genius of French rugby
text:
As Damian Penaud sauntered by in the lobby, a Canadian tourist, oblivious to the fact that he was sharing his hotel with the French rugby team, remarked: “Whoever that guy is, he has got to be a somebody.”

During France’s three-week sojourn in the Hotel Nikko (the base for their cancelled attempt at revenge over England in their pool decider) Penaud, who turned 23 four days after France’s narrow victory over Argentina, always made his presence felt.

As a wing converted from centre, Penaud has a liking for being in the middle of proceedings both on and off the field. When headlines were swirling about discontent in the French camp due to head coach Jacques Brunel wanting to axe captain Guilhem...
